description: JSON schema for pytest configuration options under `[tool.pytest]` in `pyproject.toml`.

ini_options.title: Bridge Configuration Options for `pytest.ini` File
ini_options.description: The `ini_options` table is used as a bridge between the existing `pytest.ini` configuration system and future configuration formats. `pytest.ini` takes precedence over `[tool.pytest.ini_options]` in `pyproject.toml`.

IniOptions.$comment: additionalProperties is true because the schema is merged with other schemas

addopts.description: Extra command line options to be added by default.

cache_dir.description: Sets directory for cache plugin. Can include environment variables.

consider_namespace_packages.description: Controls whether pytest attempts to identify namespace packages.

console_output_style.description: Sets console output style during test execution.

doctest_encoding.description: Sets default encoding for doctest files.

doctest_optionflags.description: Specifies doctest flag names from the `doctest` module.

empty_parameter_set_mark.description: Defines behavior for empty parameter sets in parameterization.

faulthandler_timeout.description: Sets timeout in seconds for dumping the traceback of all threads if a test takes too long.

filterwarnings.description: Sets action to take for matching warnings. Each item is a warning specification string.

junit_duration_report.description: Sets how to record test durations in JUnit XML report.

junit_family.description: Sets format of generated JUnit XML files.

junit_logging.description: Controls whether captured output is written to JUnit XML file.

junit_log_passing_tests.description: If `junit_logging` is not 'no', controls whether to include output of passing tests.

junit_suite_name.description: Sets name of root test suite in JUnit XML report.

log_auto_indent.description: Allows selective auto-indentation of multiline log messages. Can be true, false, positive integer, 'On', or 'Off'.

log_cli.description: Enables log display during test run (live logging).

log_cli_date_format.description: Sets date format for live logging using `time.strftime()` format.

log_cli_format.description: Sets message format for live logging using `logging` format.

log_cli_level.description: Sets minimum log level for live logging. Can be level name or integer value.

log_date_format.description: Sets date format for captured logging using `time.strftime()` format.

log_file.description: Sets file path to write log messages to.

log_file_date_format.description: Sets date format for log file using `time.strftime()` format.

log_file_format.description: Sets message format for log file using `logging` format.

log_file_level.description: Sets minimum log level for log file. Can be level name or integer value.

log_format.description: Sets message format for captured logging using `logging` format.

log_level.description: Sets minimum log level for captured logging. Can be level name or integer value.

markers.description: Allows registering additional markers for test functions.

norecursedirs.description: Sets base name patterns for directories to be skipped during test discovery. Uses fnmatch-style matching. Replaces default patterns.

python_classes.description: Specifies name prefixes or glob patterns for identifying test classes.

python_files.description: Specifies glob patterns for identifying Python test module files.

python_functions.description: Specifies name prefixes or glob patterns for identifying test functions and methods.

pythonpath.description: Sets list of directories to be added to the Python search path. Paths are relative to root directory.

required_plugins.description: Space-separated list of plugins required to run pytest. Can include version specifiers.

testpaths.description: Sets directories to search for tests when no specific paths are given on the command line. Paths are relative to root directory. Shell-style wildcards can be used.

tmp_path_retention_count.description: Number of sessions to retain `tmp_path` directories for.

tmp_path_retention_policy.description: Controls which `tmp_path` directories to retain based on test outcome.

usefixtures.description: List of fixtures that will be applied to all test functions.

verbosity_assertions.description: Sets verbosity specific to assertion-related output. Can be integer or 'auto'.

verbosity_test_cases.description: Sets verbosity specific to test case execution output. Can be integer or 'auto'.

xfail_strict.description: If true, test suite will fail if a test marked with `@pytest.mark.xfail` unexpectedly passes.

IniOptionsAsyncio.$comment: additionalProperties is true because the schema is merged with other schemas

asyncio_default_fixture_loop_scope.description: Default event loop scope of asynchronous fixtures. When this configuration option is unset, it defaults to the fixture scope. In future versions of pytest-asyncio, the value will default to function when unset

asyncio_default_test_loop_scope.description: Default event loop scope of asynchronous tests. When this configuration option is unset, it default to function scope

oneOf.description: Automatically handling all async functions by the plugin
Auto processing disabling (useful if different async frameworks should be tested together, e.g. both pytest-asyncio and pytest-trio are used in the same project

asyncio_mode.description: Sets the asyncio mode for pytest-asyncio.

LogLevel.description: A minimum log level. Can be level name or integer value.
